Steinbrenner Lab

The University of Washington, Seattle

Exploring plant immune systems at the University of Washington

Immune Recognition in Plants

We study the function and evolution of plant immune systems, focusing on front-line receptors to detect threats

Molecular Genetics of Plant Immunity

We use tools and approaches from genetics, genomics, biochemistry, and molecular biology to study immunity in crops and model plant species

Combating Pests in Agriculture

Our work inspires strategies to protect crops against emerging pests and pathogens



Contact the lab

Adam speaks at the 12th Japan-US Seminar in Plant Pathology

Adam will present at the 12th Japan-US Seminar in Plant Pathology on “Evolution and Function of plant receptor-like proteins (RLPs)”

Ava leaves the lab

Recently graduated senior Ava Kloss-Schmidt leaves the lab after 2.5 great years developing bean genetic resources and optimizing herbivory assays. Good luck at Carnegie Ava!

August 15, 2022

Steinbrenner lab at Plant Bio 22

We will be making the short trip to PB22 in Portland, OR. 4 lab members will present posters, and Natalia will give a talk on plant-herbivore interactions! Link to titles
